CSSLog.summary: The log() CSS function is an exponential function that returns the logarithm of a number.

remarks.para: Logarithm is the inverse of exponentiation. It is the number that a fixed base has to be raised to in order to yield the number passed as the first parameter.
In CSS, when a single parameter is passed, the natural logarithm e, or approximately 2.7182818, is used, though the base can be set to any value with an optional second parameter.

CSSLog.returns: The logarithm of value, when base is defined.The natural logarithm (base e) of value, when base is not defined.
